channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Democrats take the fight to Trump on government shutdown
item.description: Republicans are banking on Democrats blinking first to end a government shutdown . But just in case, they're going to make it as painful as possible. ...

item.title: Why October will be more treat than trick for investors
item.description: Data: Financial Modeling Prep ; Chart: Axios Visuals For investors, it's the most wonderful time of the year: the fourth quarter, historically the bes...

item.title: Scoop: How an Israeli attack inadvertently launched Trump's Gaza peace plan
item.description: The seeds of the plan President Trump presented on Monday to end the war in Gaza were planted three weeks earlier, when Israel bombed Qatar in a faile...

item.title: Trump's MAGA-fied military prepares for "war from within"
item.description: More than 800 top military brass sat quietly Tuesday as President Trump declared a new "war from within" — fixated on an American battlefield he claim...

item.title: Federal government shutdown begins after Congress fails to act
item.description: The federal government will shut down for the first time since 2019 after the Senate on Tuesday failed to pass a government funding measure ahead of a...

item.title: Congressional Democrats embrace shutdown despite political perils
item.description: House Democrats gave Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries a standing ovation in a caucus meeting Monday evening, praising his feisty posture toward Donald ...

item.title: Maryland speeders to pay more, D.C. changes health care under new laws
item.description: News laws that take effect Oct. 1 include a tiered speeding ticket system in Maryland and a pay increase for police officers in Washington, D.C.

item.title: How every senator voted on the bill to avert a government shutdown
Government shutdown begins after federal funding expires
item.description: The lapse in finances means crucial government functions will shutter until lawmakers approve more money.

item.title: Journalists shoved by federal agents outside New York immigration court
item.description: Video of the incident shows masked agents pushing two journalists to the ground, the latest confrontation between immigration officials and those docu...

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Former Trump statistics chief slams Friday firing of Erika McEntarfer
item.description: Bill Beach said the president's suggestions that the jobs report was rigged betrayed a misunderstanding in how those numbers are assembled.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
